content: Unfortunately, there is no pill or medication that can guarantee the prevention of diabetic retinopathy. Lifestyle changes like exercising and maintaining a healthy diet are important in reducing the risk of developing retinopathy or slowing its progression. While these changes may seem daunting, incorporating small changes into your daily routine can make a big difference in your overall health. You may want to consider speaking with a healthcare professional or a registered dietitian to help you create a plan that works for you based on your preferences and lifestyle. In addition to lifestyle changes, it's also important to manage your blood sugar levels and get regular eye exams to monitor for any signs of diabetic retinopathy.
